title: Advanced Metal-Air Battery Having a Ceramic Membrane Electrolyte Background of the Invention

Hybrid cells; Manufacture thereof composed of a half-cell of a fuel-cell type and a half-cell of the secondary-cell type
Separators, membranes or diaphragms characterised by their combination with electrodes
Composites in the form of layered products, e.g. coatings

abstract: A metal-air battery is disclosed in one embodiment of the invention as including a cathode to reduce oxygen molecules and an alkali-metal-containing anode to oxidize the alkali metal (e.g., Li, Na, and K) contained therein to produce alkali-metal ions. An aqueous catholyte is placed in ionic communication with the cathode to store reaction products generated by reacting the alkali-metal ions with the oxygen containing anions. These reaction products are stored as solutes dissolved in the aqueous catholyte. An ion-selective membrane is interposed between the alkali-metal containing anode and the aqueous catholyte. The ion-selective membrane is designed to be conductive to the alkali-metal ions while being impermeable to the aqueous catholyte.
claims:
1. An air-metal battery comprising:
a cathode to reduce oxygen molecules; an alkali-metal-containing anode to oxidize the alkali metal to produce alkali-metal ions; an aqueous catholyte in ionic communication with the cathode; a ion-selective membrane interposed between the alkali-metal containing anode and the aqueous catholyte, the ion-selective membrane being conductive to the alkali-metal ions while being impermeable to the aqueous catholyte.
2. The air-metal battery of claim 1, further comprising an anolyte interposed between the alkali-metal-containing anode and the ion-selective membrane to conduct the alkali-metal ions.
3. The air-metal battery of claim 2, wherein the ion-selective membrane comprises a dense layer, impermeable to the aqueous catholyte, sandwiched between porous layers.
4. The air-metal battery of claim 3, wherein the porous layers provide strength and rigidity to the dense layer.
5. The air-metal battery of claim 3, wherein the porous layers are infiltrated with the anolyte and catholyte, respectively.
6. The air-metal battery of claim 1, wherein the cathode comprises a gas-diffusion layer that is hydrophobic but permeable to oxygen, and a reaction layer to reduce the oxygen.
7. The air-metal battery of claim 6, wherein the reaction layer comprises a catalyst to at least one of reduce oxygen and produce oxygen when recharging the battery.
8. The air-metal battery of claim 7, wherein the catalyst comprises a perovskite-type compound.
9. The air-metal battery of claim 7, wherein the catalyst comprises manganese, cobalt or oxides thereof.
10. The air-metal battery of claim 1, wherein the alkali metal comprises at least one of Li, Na, and K.
11. The air-metal battery of claim 1, wherein the ion-selective membrane comprises at least one of LiSICON and NaSICON.
12. The air-metal battery of claim 1, wherein the aqueous catholyte is a separator material soaked in an aqueous catholyte solution.

13. A method comprising:
generating alkali-metal ions at an anode; transporting the alkali-metal ions through an ion-selective membrane that is impermeable to water; transporting the alkali-metal ions through an aqueous catholyte solution; reacting the alkali-metal ions with oxygen containing anions generated at a cathode to produce a reaction product; and storing the reaction product as a solute dissolved in the aqueous catholyte solution.
14. The method of claim 13, further comprising transporting the alkali-metal ions through an anolyte interposed between the anode and the ion-selective membrane.

15. The method of claim 14, wherein transporting the alkali-metal ions through an ion-selective membrane comprises transporting the alkali-metal ions through a dense layer, impermeable to the aqueous catholyte, sandwiched between porous layers.
16. The method of claim 15, wherein the porous layers provide strength and rigidity to the dense layer.
17. The method of claim 15, wherein the porous layers are infiltrated with the anolyte and catholyte, respectively.

18. The method of claim 13, wherein the cathode comprises a gas-diffusion layer that is hydrophobic but permeable to oxygen, and a reaction layer to reduce the oxygen to produce the oxygen containing anions.
19. The method of claim 18, further comprising infiltrating the reaction layer with a catalyst to aid in reducing the oxygen.
20. The method of claim 19, wherein the catalyst comprises a perovskite-type compound.
21. The method of claim 19, wherein the catalyst comprises manganese, cobalt or oxides thereof.
22. The method of claim 13, wherein the alkali-metal ions comprise at least one of Li, Na, and K ions.
23. The method of claim 13, wherein the ion-selective membrane comprises at least one of LiSICON and NaSICON.

24. The method of claim 13, wherein transporting the alkali-metal ions through an aqueous catholyte solution comprises transporting the alkali-metal ions through a separator material soaked in an aqueous catholyte solution.

25. An air-metal battery comprising:
a cathode to reduce oxygen molecules to produce oxygen containing anions; an alkali-metal-containing anode to oxidize the alkali metal contained therein to produce alkali-metal ions; a catholyte solution in ionic communication with the cathode to conduct the alkali-metal ions and store, in the form of a dissolved solute, a reaction product produced by reacting the oxygen containing anions with the alkali-metal ions; an ion-selective membrane interposed between the alkali-metal containing anode and the catholyte solution, the ion-selective membrane being conductive to the alkali-metal ions while being impermeable to the catholyte solution.
